sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>soul</radical> in your <radical>toe</radical> leaves <radical>early</radical>. You <kanji>grieve</kanji> and <kanji>mourn</kanji> for your now-dead toe.
meaningInfo: Look at your toe. It has no soul. It's dark and shriveled, like a mummy's toe. Grieve and watch your tears drip onto it.
readingMnemonic: You decide to <kanji>grieve</kanji> in <ja><reading>とう</reading>きょう</ja>. Your toe always wanted to walk in <ja>とうきょう</ja>, and now you can at least fulfill its dying wish.
readingInfo: Walk through the streets of <ja>とうきょう</ja> grieving, with your dead toe flopping onto the pavement.
